result.execSummary:
The defendant Tommy A Crawford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tommy A Crawford

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tommy A Crawford in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

As to Count 1:
The Court ordered defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 79 days time served, STRAIGHT TIME. 

Court previously ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs, fees, surcharges and a $500.00 fine which has been paid.

Court objects to Electronic Monitoring.

As to Count 3:
The Court ordered defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 30 days time served, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges by 8/29/2018, or to be docketed as a civil judgment/tax intercept.

Court objects to expungement.

Filed;
-Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

PURSUANT TO Felony Division Directive 04-03 dated December 15, 2004 -
As sentencing judge, this case is assigned and forwarded to Judge Siefert, Br. 47, for sentencing after revocation of probation.
Received from the Department of Corrections, Request for Sentencing After Revocation of Defendant's Probation.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  rmm

Sentencing Proceeded. Statements made by both parties and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Court withheld sentence and placed defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 3 YEARS after completion of sentence in cases 13CM4849, 13CM5356, and 14CM2349.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
Court ordered no possession or use of dangerous weapons.
AODA assessment and follow through with recommended programming.
Fine of $500.00 including mandatory costs from bail on deposit.

AS TO COUNT 3
Defendant sentenced to serve 30 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence.  Huber privileges under Sec.303.08 Wis. Stats. to apply for work.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 3 YEARS after completion of sentence in cases 13CM4849, 13CM5356, and 14CM2349. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
AODA assessment and follow through with recommended programming.
Court ordered all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges to be paid by 5/12/2019. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court will consider motion for expungement if defendant pays the fine and costs, successfully completes the sentence, reports to the House of Corrections by date given, and has no further violations of the law raising to the level of probable cause.

Filed, 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, 
Global Resolution Form.

Defendant Tommy A Crawford in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case set for Plea and Sentencing. Defense requests an adjourned Sentencing date. Court denied defense request. State placed plea negotiations on the record. Parties have reached a resolution. Defense advised court there is a global recommendation. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

AS TO COUNT 2
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on motion of the State, Court ordered count 2 Dismissed, but Read In. 

AS TO COUNT 3
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 05-12-2015 at 08:30 am.

  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 04-17-2015 at 01:30 pm.

  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 04-02-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court, defendant Tommy A Crawford not in court, in custody.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense withdrew bail motion.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch
 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 03-03-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription AND no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Tommy A Crawford in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Tommy A Crawford in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant HAS LOWER PENDING MISDEMEANOR CASES AND is advised that this case is assigned to Judge SIEFERT.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.  Defendant entered a plea of not guilty.  DEFENDANT DOES  NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER  REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for BAIL/BOND HEARING in Branch 47.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for January 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
